Description: Body sherd of Corinthian black-figured pottery alabastron; exterior: black-figure decoration, hoplite marching right (part of round shield with added red in centre and added white dots around edge and legs); alternating black and white bands and dotted rosette as filling ornament; banding below.
Curator's comments: For parallels regarding the iconography, see New York 06.1021.19 and British Museum 1860,0404.13, which, according to Amyx is related to the Middle Corinthian Late Warrior Frieze Painter (Amyx 1988, 156).
Bibliographic references: Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p. 218, no. 11)
Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 61, no. A32)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GB.146) (Phase 1)
